page.title: 10A Publican.
page.content: Mr. John Fitzgerald is the landlord of the Horse and Jockey public house at Curbridge.This old pub., which dates back over 100 yrs., is built on the banks of the River Hamble. Before coming here he was in the Royal Navy. His day starts at 6 a.m. and finishes at 11.30 p.m. He has 1 rest day if he is lucky. He enjoys the licensed trade and has between 2 and 3,000 customers in a week. His busiest times are from Easter to mid Sept. with the weekends being the busiest. He depends more on customers from out of the area than locals. The mens most popular drink is H.S.B.,a very strong local beer. Wine is most popular with women. He sells snacks and bar food, but children are not allowed inside until they are 18. If he was not a publican he would like to own a fish and chip shop.
